parameters: You use the seal to take down the magic barrier.
Entering the cave, you see only darkness.
Then, something moves in the shadows...
A ball of flame lights up the room, flying at you!
You've defeated the dragon king!
You hear multiple loud wails coming from the dark cave.
You book it out of there before anything else comes at you.
You are stopped by a magical barrier to the cave entrance.
You take the seal out and hold it up to the shield.
The magic dissipates, and you peer into the darkness.
A low voice comes from within.
Monster
Dragon King
"Who enters my lair?"
"Why are you here, human?"
"You took my troops to yourself..."
"Yet you come... alone?"
As he talks, the Dragon King walks into sight.
His massive, hulking, bipedal form blocks your view.
You hurriedly expain the situation.
He looks at you, eyes widening.
Monster
Dragon King
"An army? Here? My mates will be in danger!"
"We must stop them before they arrive!"
The Dragon King takes a horn out of his belt and blows it.
You hear thundering footsteps outside of the cave.
Turning around, you see allies of every race coming.
Goblins, Orcs, Slimes, Harpies, and Minotaurs leading them.
Monster
Dragon King
"You are not part of this battle, human."
"However, for bringing me this information..."
"I shall give you some supplies."
"Just in case you ever need to fight.
The Dragon roars into his lair.
He then pushes you into the darkness.
You're grabbed by a pair of smaller, yet still scaly, hands.
They pull you into the darkness as a feminine voice speaks.
"Shh, little human... we're going to hide you away."
"That horrific battle is not for a diplomat."
"Thank you for bringing us this news. We will protect you."
You hear voices outside the cave, then silence.
You hear footsteps and the clink of chainmail from far away.
They get closer...
And closer...
"Halt! We are not here to fight you!"
The air in the cave resonates with the confusion you feel.
"We know the adventurer is here. Please, bring them out."
You slowly emerge from the cave, blinking in the sunlight.
You walk through the throng of other races.
You finally get through them, and are greeted by a knight.
It's the guard who handed you the map!
People4
Head Knight
"As you know, the Mayor is our leader."
"However, in my 34 years on the planet...
"He's never aged once. I talked to my parents."
"They were also born during his reign."
People4
Head Knight
"My grandparents say the same."
"3 generations, and he's never died or aged?"
"The rest of my troop has confirmed the story."
"There's something going on."
People4
Head Knight
"Can you help us overthrow the Mayor?"
"Please... we'd be forever in your debt."
*This was addressed to the crowd.*
Monster
Dragon King
*He looks toward the Minotaurs.*
*Jake is clearly visible, and nods his head.*
"I believe... we can."
Your army starts its march toward the town.
You stare into the abyss of the cave.
You hear... noises inside. A dying dragon.
You take out a torch and carefully walk in.
All the way in the back, is a disgusting sight.
Hordes of female dragon bodies lay about, all decaying.
One female remains, dying, but with no obvious wounds.
She sees you, and tries to blow a fireblast at you.
Nothing comes out, and she lowers her head, defeated.
You raid the cave for supplies before leaving.
You find 5 healing potions.
You also find a first aid kit to patch yourself up.
One thing bothers you as you leave...
What did this to them? What's happening? You may never know.
However, it's done with. You only have one hour left now.
You must get to the forest and find Nebula.
You reach the cave entrance for the second time.
The cave is eerily silent. Are the Dragons not here?
You turn to leave before seeing a shadow cross overhead.
The Dragon King glides down and lands in front of you.
Monster
Dragon King
"Welcome back, diplomat."
"Word has reached me of your recent affairs."
"Don't think to make me into a swooning idiot."
"I'm not looking for another Mate."
You tell the Dragon King that you are simply here to learn.
You have always been curious about races' cultures.
You did not mean to seek romance with anyone.
It just sort of... happened.
Monster
Dragon King
"Well, take this as a warning:"
"Try anything, and you'll be my next meal."
"As for learning about culture and whatnot..."
"Our race is dying with no way to save us now."
Monster
Dragon King
"...So there's no point in trying to learn."
"Besides, our ancient ways were lost long ago."
"We no longer have a 'culture.'"
"We simply exist... for now."
You nod slowly, still convinced SOMETHING can be done.
Something HAS to be able to bring back the Dragons.
You express that you're working on an answer.
The Dragon King... laughs? A dark, humorless laugh.
Monster
Dragon King
"Heroes... so naive. Try if you please..."
"I won't stop you from spending your time on.."
"On nothingness. Maybe one day you'll realize."
"...Probably not. You're a hero, after all."
His words are said in a depressed, cynical tone.
He clearly gave up long ago. You, however, have made a vow:
You WILL save the Dragons from their fate. No. Matter. What.
You look defiantly in the Dragon King's eyes as you speak.
Monster
Dragon King
"...To care so much for another race..."
"One that you, only a year ago, warred with..."
Monster
Dragon King
*He sighs* "Return in a few days."
"I will tell you what I know of our kind."
"Now is not a good time, as we are hunting."
"We hunt for a week out of every month."
Monster
Dragon King
"This way, we have a nice stockpile of meat."
"Which will last us for three weeks..."
"Until, of course, the next hunt time arrives."
"That is all I will say of our ways for now."
You thank the Dragon King and bow to him.
Then, you mount your horse as he takes flight.
You notice that despite his size, he's graceful in the air.
You shake your head. Remember, this is JUST for knowledge.
You return to the Dragon's Den. It's been a week, now.
Maybe the Dragon King won't be as busy?
You peer into the darkness, letting your eyes adjust.
As you do, you see the outlines of Dragons.
One of them sees you, though you can barely see her.
She calls out: "My king, the diplomat has returned!"
"Shall we send the human away?" You listen for a response.
You hear him, but he's too far inside to understand.
You then hear massive footsteps coming at you from within.
The Dragon King comes just within view, and shakes his head.
The Dragon Mate bows to him and returns to her duties.
You ask if this is a bad time. The King steps into view.
Monster
Dragon King
"I told you to return when we weren't hunting."
"You did so, and there's nothing else to do."
"I will answer one or two questions today."
"That is all I'm in the mood for..."
Your first question is the biggest on your mind:
How did he, of all other male Dragons, survive?
Was he stronger than the others? Smarter? Faster?
He heaves a heavy sigh.
Monster
Dragon King
"Truthfully, it is not because I was better."
"In fact, our best warriors went down first."
"Humans hunted us to prove prowess."
"I was seen as too easy a target."
Monster
Dragon King
"Let me explain myself further:"
"I am extremely small for a male."
"Most male dragons..."
"They were twice the size of their mates."
Monster
Dragon King
"I managed to escape their grasp..."
"Simply because many humans saw me as female."
"Yes, I am larger than my mates..."
"But honestly? My mates are all runts like me."
The King is the runt of the pack? But... how?
From what you know of Dragons, only females can be runts.
The confusion on your face is clearly evident.
The Dragon King is quick to address it.
Monster
Dragon King
"I can see you're confused about my runthood."
"I was the child of a brother and sister..."
"In a long line of similar incestual mates."
"Due to this, I was born female, technically."
Monster
Dragon King
"But the baseline for Dragons before hatching?"
"We are all formed as males first."
"Then, based on available nutrients..."
"We form as full females or full males."
Monster
Dragon King
"Due to this, mixed with the incest issue..."
"I never, well... Never formed as a female."
"I stayed male as a rare bodily deformation."
"So yes, I am gentically female..."
Monster
Dragon King
"However, my body and mind are entirely male."
"So that's how I managed to survive:"
"I am genetically a female..."
"So, I was not seen as a threat."
You thank the Dragon King for his time, bow, and leave.
You need some time to process this new information.
Humans' biology is the exact opposite:
They form as female in the womb and later become male...
You decide to come back in another month.
You don't want to bother the Dragon King TOO much.
Besides, it'll be Spring by then!
Perhaps he'll be in a better mood during the warm weather.
You arrive back at the Dragons' Den only to hear...
...Crying? Yes, crying. And LOTS of it. Mourning, even.
You rush into the cave, afraid for the Dragon King.
You then, of course, trip over the tail of one of the Mates.
You strain your eyes in the dark. She picks you up.
She then takes you away from the mourners and speaks:
"Now is not a good time for you to visit. Please..."
"Come back in the Summer."
You nod respectfully, and she takes you to the entrance.
You ask if the Dragon King is OK, and she nods back.
She tells you it's his eldest mate who they are mourning.
She also mentions that she will talk to the King...
...And mention your respectfulness and kindness.
Many would continue to ask questions or insist to stay.
Many more, also, would not even care to check on him.
She promises to put in a good word for you as you exit.
It's been three months since you last visited the Dragons.
It's now just barely Summer. You hope they're not hunting.
As you reach the Cave, the Dragon King steps out.
This time he looks at you with a warm, welcoming smile.
Monster
Dragon King
"I apologize for the upset last time."
"Spring is... difficult for Dragons."
"I will explain why if you would like."
*As you nod fiercely, he begins his lesson:*
Monster
Dragon King
"Once a year, the eldest Dragon Mate dies."
"It matters not her age, nor her health..."
"All that matters is her standing in the pack."
"She was not only a Mate, of course..."
Monster
Dragon King
"...As per Dragon culture, she was my sister."
"I cannot tell you how hard it is, every year."
"The fact that our females' bodies are bound."
"They are bound to the males' aging process."
Monster
Dragon King
"She was the last of my older siblings."
"All that are left are younger than me..."
"And with her, dies the majority of our race."
"She was the only one who knew our full story."
Monster
Dragon King
"She taught me all she could of our culture."
"However, I am too grief-stricken to remember."
"At least, remember most of it."
"You are probably wondering about the males:"
Monster
Dragon King
"We do not die of age, nor connection."
"Only unnatural causes can kill us."
"However, when the last male in a pack dies..."
"The females have about 24 hours to search."
Monster
Dragon King
"If they can not find another mate in time..."
"They all pass away, as their link is broken."
"This is a curse from days long passed."
"A curse of the demon, Nebula."
Monster
Dragon King
"Yes, the very demon your Mayor worshipped."
"Honestly... he stinks heavily of it."
"I'm almost certain Nebula still controls him."
"However, without proof, I can't declare war."
Monster
Dragon King
"Now, friend, let me grieve a little more."
"This whole talk has opened the wound again."
"I do appreciate the listening ear..."
"And your respect and compassion at this time."
You bow and thank the Dragon King. This time, though?
The Dragon King lowers his head in a sort-of-bow, too.
He welcomes you in return, and the two of you leave.
You realize that he's beginning to see you as an equal!
You return after another month. It's now midsummer.
Festivals are going on in every town.
You're too curious about Dragons to bother with it, though.
There will be other midsummers, but who knows how long...
You shake the thought out of your head.
Despite your best efforts, you are beginning to care.
That is, care more than you should about the Dragon King.
But, that's just it... you don't even know his name!
The Dragon king once again greets you with a smile.
However, when you ask your question, it falls.
He gets close to your face, looking stern.
When he does speak, it's in a very serious tone:
Monster
Dragon King
"That, my friend, is for trusted Dragons ONLY."
*He pulls back, his gaze softening*
"Ah, I forgot for a moment you do not know."
"Apologies, I will allow it this once."
Monster
Dragon King
"You see, Dragons' names hold power."
"To know it allows you control over them."
"It can be used for good..."
"Or it can be used for evil."
Monster
Dragon King
"This is why Dragons save this knowledge."
"They give their names to Mates to show trust."
"Only Mates ever get close enough to earn it."
"And I said I'm not looking for another Mate."
You apologize, and ask if he wants you to leave.
You can tell you upset him unintentionally.
He tells you to return in a day or two, and you head out.
As the two of you bow, though...
You finally notice the amber gem embedded in his skull.
Now is not the time to bring it up...
Perhaps tomorrow you will ask about it?
It's been two days since you left the upset the Dragon King.
You return, unsure how he'll react.
It seems, however, he's forgiven you.
In fact, he greets you with a bear hug!
Monster
Dragon King
"Ah, the diplomat is back!"
"Honestly, I was hoping you'd return sooner."
"All is well, though. You came back."
"I assume you have more questions?"
You ask the question that's bothered you for 2 days now:
What is the symbolization of the amber, eye-shaped gem?
The King's eyes gleam as he prepares to answer.
He seems especially excited about this one.
Monster
Dragon King
"Yes, the family gem! Isn't it gorgeous?"
"Every Dragon family had one."
"They each symbolized something, too."
"Ours, the Eye of Amber, symbolizes foresight."
Monster
Dragon King
"At one time, the gems were useful..."
"The Dragons would pick rulers base on gems."
"Then, it became a way to keep track of death."
"Now it's simply a reminder of a bygone era."
Monster
Dragon King
"Perhaps one day, through your research..."
"It can be a symbol of hope once again."
*He smiles caringly at you, almost lovingly*
*He bows and makes his way back to the cave*
Your heart is racing and giddy as you leave.
Could the Dragon King be falling for you?
You've not spent much time with him at all...
But for some reason, you're falling fast for this guy.
The Mate you're riding with lands at the cave entrance.
You planned to dismount, but she starts walking inside.
You realize she's helping you to find the King.
You're blind as a bat in here!
As you walk through, you hear his breathing.
Then, the Mate stops, and lowers her back for dismount.
Your eyes finally start adjusting to the dark.
You spot the Dragon King laying on the ground, eyes on you.
Monster
Oswald
"Oswald. My name... My name is Oswald."
*You two stare lovingly, knowing the truth now*
You know, maybe this diplomat thing isn't so bad...
But now it's time to move on, other adventures await!
Perhaps, this time you'll try a different approach...
You've reached the end, my friend.
It's time to close the game.
Perhaps, again, my friend,
We'll meet someday.
Every action has purpose,
And every purpose has an outcome.
Whether or not it seems on surface,
You're never the only one.
